trans-unit.source: Web Services and ACS
trans-unit.target: Web Services and ACS

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Web Services and ACS
trans-unit.target: Web Services and ACS

trans-unit.source: The following are the participants of the basic scenario in which a web service is integrated with <token>firstref_acs</token>:
trans-unit.target: The following are the participants of the basic scenario in which a web service is integrated with <token>firstref_acs</token>:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Your web service.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Your web service.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Client</embeddedLabel>—A web service client that is attempting to gain access to your web service.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Client</embeddedLabel>—A web service client that is attempting to gain access to your web service.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Identity Provider</embeddedLabel>—A site or service that can authenticate the client.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Identity Provider</embeddedLabel>—A site or service that can authenticate the client.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel><token>secondref_acs</token></embeddedLabel>—The partition of <token>secondref_acs</token> that is dedicated to your relying party application.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel><token>secondref_acs</token></embeddedLabel>—The partition of <token>secondref_acs</token> that is dedicated to your relying party application.

trans-unit.source: However, the web service scenario assumes that the client does not have access to a browser and is acting autonomously (without a user directly participating in the scenario).
trans-unit.target: However, the web service scenario assumes that the client does not have access to a browser and is acting autonomously (without a user directly participating in the scenario).

trans-unit.source: The client must obtain a security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> in order to log on to your service.
trans-unit.target: The client must obtain a security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> in order to log on to your service.

trans-unit.source: This token is a signed message from <token>secondref_acs</token> to your application, with a set of claims about the client’s identity.
trans-unit.target: This token is a signed message from <token>secondref_acs</token> to your application, with a set of claims about the client’s identity.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> does not issue a token unless the client first proves his or her identity.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> does not issue a token unless the client first proves his or her identity.

trans-unit.source: In a web service and <token>secondref_acs</token> scenario, a client can prove his or her identity in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: In a web service and <token>secondref_acs</token> scenario, a client can prove his or her identity in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: By authenticating directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Service Identity credential types
trans-unit.target: By authenticating directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Service Identity credential types

trans-unit.source: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following figure illustrates the web service scenario with the client proving his identity with <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity credential types.
trans-unit.target: The following figure illustrates the web service scenario with the client proving his identity with <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity credential types.

trans-unit.source: The client authenticates with <token>secondref_acs</token> using one of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Service Identity credential types.
trans-unit.target: The client authenticates with <token>secondref_acs</token> using one of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Service Identity credential types.

trans-unit.source: In <token>secondref_acs</token>, this can be a Simple Web Token (SWT) token signed with a symmetric key, an X.509 certificate, or a password.
trans-unit.target: In <token>secondref_acs</token>, this can be a Simple Web Token (SWT) token signed with a symmetric key, an X.509 certificate, or a password.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> validates the received credentials, inputs the received identity claims into the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine, calculates the output claims, and creates a token that contains those claims.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> validates the received credentials, inputs the received identity claims into the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine, calculates the output claims, and creates a token that contains those claims.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token to the client.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token to the client.

trans-unit.source: The client sends the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token to the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: The client sends the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token to the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: The relying party application validates the token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> and then returns the requested resource representation.
trans-unit.target: The relying party application validates the token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> and then returns the requested resource representation.

trans-unit.source: By presenting a security token from another trusted issuer (Identity Provider) that has authenticated that client
trans-unit.target: By presenting a security token from another trusted issuer (Identity Provider) that has authenticated that client

trans-unit.source: The following figure illustrates the web service scenario with the client proving his identity with a security token from an Identity Provider.
trans-unit.target: The following figure illustrates the web service scenario with the client proving his identity with a security token from an Identity Provider.

trans-unit.source: The client logs in to the Identity Provider (for example, sends the credentials).
trans-unit.target: The client logs in to the Identity Provider (for example, sends the credentials).

trans-unit.source: After the client is authenticated, the Identity Provider issues a token.
trans-unit.target: After the client is authenticated, the Identity Provider issues a token.

trans-unit.source: The Identity Provider returns the token to the client.
trans-unit.target: The Identity Provider returns the token to the client.

trans-unit.source: The client sends the Identity Provider-issued token to <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: The client sends the Identity Provider-issued token to <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> validates the Identity Provider-issued token, inputs the data in the Identity Provider-issued token to the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine, calculates the output claims, and creates a token that contains those claims.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> validates the Identity Provider-issued token, inputs the data in the Identity Provider-issued token to the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine, calculates the output claims, and creates a token that contains those claims.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> issues a token to the client.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> issues a token to the client.

trans-unit.source: The client sends the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token to the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: The client sends the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token to the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: The relying party application validates the signature on the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token, and validates the claims in the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token.
trans-unit.target: The relying party application validates the signature on the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token, and validates the claims in the <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued token.

trans-unit.source: The relying party application returns the requested resource representation.
trans-unit.target: The relying party application returns the requested resource representation.
